oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Advertisement from Nashville City Directory, 1871
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A page of advertisement from the 1871 Nashville City Directory featuring 1) C.R. Parsons & Co., Cotton Commission Merchants, “flour grain and provisions, nos. 7 and 9 Broad Street;” 2) Southern Book Bindery, no. 37 1-2 Union Street, George S. Morton; 3) Hurley & Glascock, receiving, forwarding, storage Commission Merchants, and registered wholesale liquor dealers, nos. 73 and 75 Broad Street in downtown Nashville, Tennessee; and 4) E.C. Minchin, established 1856, Druggist and Prescriptionist, 184 Spruce Street, Near South Union. Forms part of Nashville City Directory Collection, Metro Archives. 1 digital image.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Morton, George S.
C.R. Parsons & Co. (Nashville, Tenn.); Southern Book Bindery (Nashville, Tenn.); Hurley & Glascock (Nashville, Tenn.); E.C. Minchin (Nashville, Tenn.)
